Roadmapïƒ

Overviewïƒ

The NGF + Microâ€‘LM ecosystem has completed Tierâ€‘1 (deterministic SBERT mappers) and Tierâ€‘2 (SBERT + WDD auditors). The next phase extends into richer latents, new domains, and open theoretical questions.

Tier-0: Baseline Deterministic Rails (âœ” Secured)ïƒ

  • Stock matched filter + parser pipeline.

  • Supports core DeFi primitives with deterministic abstain paths.

  • Sandbox verified and benchmarked with stable execution.

Status: âœ… Complete â€” foundation secured.

â€”

Tier-1: Micro-LM on SBERT Latents (âœ” Secured)ïƒ

  • Replace hashmap lookups with a trained micro-LM encoder.

  • Train against 2â€“5k SBERT latent prompts.

  • Audit results to return ABSTAIN / PASS with auditable trace.

  • Benchmark with full Stage-11 runner on DeFi suites (1% hallucination / 0.98 F1 Score across 8 primitives).

Status: âœ… Complete â€” MVP secured.

â€”

Tier-2: Incorporate WDD with SBERT Latents (âœ” Secured)ïƒ

The current release implements Warp â†’ Detect â†’ Denoise (WDD) on SBERT embeddings.

Core Features - Deterministic mapper + verifier with abstain-first behavior. - Handles both DeFi prompts (financial primitives) and ARC prompts (cognitive/aptitude tasks). - Auditable traces: every PASS/ABSTAIN decision includes reasons + confidence. - Stress-tested on SBERT latents: validated signal separation + denoising.

Status: âœ… Complete â€” WDD secured. Purpose: Community Edition, deterministic & auditable safety (but scoped), SBERT + WDD â€” Apache 2.0.

â€”

Tier-3: LLM Latents + WDD (ğŸ”® Future / Enterprise)ïƒ

The end-goal is to extend WDD beyond SBERT into large language model hidden states.

Planned Features - Swap SBERT latents for LLM internal latents. - Apply WDD rails to noisy LLM embeddings â†’ restore determinism. - Package as a sidecar system: LLM provides fluency, micro-LM provides deterministic safety. - Designed for enterprise use: auditability, compliance, SLAs.

Status: ğŸ”® Planning stage â€” not required for MVP, proprietary development path. Purpose: Enterprise Edition: gold standard, LLM Latents + WDD â€” proprietary.

Future Domainsïƒ

Microâ€‘LMs can extend beyond ARC and DeFi into other highâ€‘stakes or structured domains:

  • Healthcare: clinical notes â†’ orders with dosage verifiers.

  • Manufacturing/Robotics: operator prompts â†’ deterministic motion plans with collision/torque checks.

  • Supply Chain: planning instructions â†’ workflows with capacity/customs checks.

  • Energy/Grid: operator dispatch â†’ safe load balancing actions.

  • Legal/Contracts: clause parsing â†’ compliance checks, abstains on ambiguity.

These domains all benefit from NGFâ€™s determinism, abstains, and auditability.

Open Research Questionsïƒ

  1. Latent Generalization: how best to warp/detect/denoise noisy LLM latents?

  2. Audit/Mapper Dynamics: can we formalize auditor vs mapper as a general pattern for sidecar AI systems?

  3. Abstain Philosophy: what are the limits of abstainâ€‘first reasoning, and how can abstains be integrated into humanâ€‘AI workflows?

  4. Scalability: how do NGF rails scale as domain complexity grows (more primitives, larger context windows)?

  5. Crossâ€‘Domain Bridges: can one Microâ€‘LM share priors or rails with another, or must each be trained/audited independently?

Summaryïƒ

The roadmap is ambitious but clear: extend NGF rails to LLM latents, expand Microâ€‘LM applications to critical domains, and refine abstainâ€‘centric reasoning into a universal safety doctrine for AI.
